avalancheActivity.highlights: A lot of snow has drifted from the area. Wind slabs have formed in the mountains after SW and W snow showers and strong winds. Becoming warmer with considereble rain on Thursday to Friday and the snowcover can become unstable to begin with but will strengthen when it freezes again.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow is covering the region but much has drifted away. Wind slabs have formed on N- and E- facing aspects. Snowprofile was taken in Bláfjöll 30th of Jan in NW facing aspect. The profile showed layers of hard windslabs with layers of hail in between. Extended stability test gave fracture at high stress, (ECTN26 @80cm).  Becoming warmer with considereble rain on Thursday to Friday and the snowcover can become unstable to begin with. The snowcover is expected to become stable with cooling temperatures. Ongoing SW wind and snowshowers will continue forming wind slabs and cornices in the mountains this weekend.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.

weatherForecast.highlights: S-læg átt með éljum eða skúrum á fimmtudag, færist í austan og tekur að hlýna með rigningu fram á föstudags morgun, kólnar með SV éljagani.

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalnches fell on Súðavíkurhlíð evening of 30th of jan. Many avalanches, most of them small, released in the area during and after heavy but short snowfall and snowdrift on early Thursday 25 January.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Unstable windslabs have built up in W to E facing aspects. Strong NW to NE winds Wednesday afternoon and windslabs are expected to form in southerly facing aspects and can be unstable.

snowpackStructure.highlights: During the last week, snow has added and drifted in variable wind, especially SW. Before, there was little snow in the area. The night before Thursday, it snowed heavily for a while, first in NE directions, then in E and SW directions. As a result, many small avalanches released in the forecast area, on slopes facing various directions. Now there is considerable new snow in the area. Snowprofile taken 30th of Jan in Seljalandsdalur showed layered windslabs with a hard thin layer between them on top of melt/freeze snow. Compression test gave straight fracture by medium stress in the new windslabs (CT13/15@56cm). Wind will turn in NV-NE on Wednesday afternoon for a time and snow can drift into southerly aspects. SV snowshowers on Thursday.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.

weatherForecast.highlights: Suðvestan 10-15 og él eða slydduél á fimmtudag, hiti við frostmark. Breytilegar áttir og él á köflum næstu daga.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few avalanches occurred last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Windslabs are at high elevations, especially on N-E aspects after strong SW winds. It will snow on Friday during E-winds but rain and thaw could later reach up to the mountain tops.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Windslabs and cornices are present at high elevations, especially on N-E aspects after strong SW-winds. Weak layer could be present in the snowpack, and a persistent weak layer could be at very high elevations. It will snow during strong E-winds but later rain, and the thaw could reach up to the mountain tops.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.

weatherForecast.highlights: Áframhaldandi SV-átt og él, mjög hvöss um tíma á fimmtudag. Hlýnar á fimmtudag og aðfaranótt föstudags gengur lægð yfir landið með snjókomu í hvassri A-átt en síðar rigningu og gæti hlánað upp í efstu toppa. Kólnar fljótt aftur og snýst í SV-átt.

avalancheActivity.comment: A few small avalanches occurred in Norðfjörður last weekend. A small wet sluff occurred above Neskaupstaður last week.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The snow thawed a bit on Monday. Thin windslabs could be present, mainly on N-E aspects. Chances of wet avalanches on Friday.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow thawed a bit on Monday evening and a thin layer of snow was added on Tuesday, which could drift on easterly aspects. Thin windslabs had formed, especially on N-E aspects. Friday looks like rain but snow at very high elevations, the thaw will reach up to the mountain tops before freezing again.

travelAdvisory.comment: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Wind slabs have formed in SW directions around the country. A low arrives the night before Friday with rain and show. Thaw, especially in the south and east, and possible wet avalanches.

weatherForecast.highlights: Vestlæg eða breytileg átt og hlýnar á fimmtudag. Aðfaranótt föstudags gengur lægð yfir landið með rigningu, en snjókomu hátt til fjalla. Hlýnar um tíma upp í efstu toppa en snýst aftur í SV/V-átt og frystir.
